intro: Dicoma burmanni, commonly known as the Burmann's dicoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. Dicoma burmanni is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to dry environments.
